Title: Information Systems Risk Analysis Using Octave Allegro Method Based at Deutsche Bank
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Binus Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sardjono, W., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Binus Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Cholik, M.I., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Binus Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Awareness of the importance of information system security and its assets to an organization and the impact that may arise from the destruction of the information system and its assets does not seem to be getting attention for most organizations. Risk assessment is part of the risk management of information systems, conducted to assess how likely the threats and vulnerabilities to information systems and their assets. This study aims to perform risk analysis on enterprise information systems in corporation using factor analysis. The end result of the risk assessment is recommendations on the steps to be taken for the protection of information systems and their assets. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: factor analysis; risk analysis; risk management
Index Keywords: Factor analysis; Information systems; Information use; Multivariant analysis; Risk analysis; Risk assessment; Risk management; Deutsche Bank; Enterprise information system; Information system security; Management of information systems; Threats and vulnerabilities; Information management
